You know what? You're right that I should talk to her directly about this. I've been so focused on trying to figure out the "right" thing to do that I haven't really asked her what she actually wants me to do.

I think part of me has been avoiding that conversation because I'm scared of what she might say. Like, what if she tells me not to risk it? Then I'd have to live with watching her fail when I could have helped. But what if she says yes and we both get caught? 

I guess I've been trying to make this decision for both of us, which isn't really fair to her.

The more I think about it, the more I realize this isn't just about the exam. It's about what kind of friendship we have and what we're both comfortable with. Maybe she'd rather fail on her own than succeed knowing I put my future at risk for her. Or maybe she'd feel like I abandoned her if I don't help when she asked.

I think I need to have a real conversation with her about all of this - the risks, the ethics, what we can both live with. Not just "can you help me cheat" but really talking through what this means for both of us.

Thanks for helping me think through this. I was so caught up in the immediate crisis that I wasn't seeing the bigger picture about choice and consent and what we both actually want.

I should probably go talk to her now before I lose my nerve.

<END>
